thread.title: KSL.com college football Players of the Week (Week 5)
thread.title_full: KSL.com college football Players of the Week (Week 5)

title: KSL.com college football Players of the Week (Week 5)
text:
BYU bounced back from its scoreless effort against Michigan and beat Connecticut Saturday in 17-point win. Utah State, too, bounced back from some early-season troubles and beat a difficult Colorado State team to give the Aggies their first Mountain West Conference win of the season. 
The KSL Sports staff has chosen to honor three players this week from Utah with the Player of the Week award. Add your vote to the three polls below. Did the KSL Sports staff make the right call? Tell us in the comment section. 


Mangum bounced back from a poor performance the week before and took care of business against Connecticut. Mangum was 35-of-53 for 365 yards and two touchdowns and two interceptions. 
nsive Player of the Week Kyler Facrell, LB, Utah State 
Fackrell continues to have a good year, and it didn't stop against Colorado State. Fackrell ended the game with six total tackles, three of which were for a loss. Fackrell also had one sack and six QB hits. He also recovered a Colorado State fumble for a 12-yard return. Honorable Mentions: 
Sae Tautu, LB, BYU: Tautu led the Cougars in total tackles with six, three of which were for a loss. He added one sack against the Huskies. Specialist Player of the Week Brock Warren, PK, Utah State 
Warren was perfect on the night, making three of his three field goal. His made field goals were from distances of 23 yards, 34 yards and 40 yards. He was also perfect in his PAT attempts on the night. 
Note: There were no other players nominated on special teams this week. KSL.com More stories you may be interested in SPONSORED
